lines.text: We both had done the math. Kelly added it all up and... knew she had to let me go. I added it up, and knew that I had... lost her. 'cos I was never gonna get off that island. I was gonna die there, totally alone. I was gonna get sick, or get injured or something. The only choice I had, the only thing I could control was when, and how, and where it was going to happen. So... I made a rope and I went up to the summit, to hang myself. I had to test it, you know? Of course. You know me. And the weight of the log, snapped the limb of the tree, so I-I - , I couldn't even kill myself the way I wanted to. I had power over *nothing*. And that's when this feeling came over me like a warm blanket. I knew, somehow, that I had to stay alive. Somehow. I had to keep breathing. Even though there was no reason to hope. And all my logic said that I would never see this place again. So that's what I did. I stayed alive. I kept breathing. And one day my logic was proven all wrong because the tide came in, and gave me a sail. And now, here I am. I'm back. In Memphis, talking to you. I have ice in my glass... And I've lost her all over again. I'm so sad that I don't have Kelly. But I'm so grateful that she was with me on that island. And I know what I have to do now. I gotta keep breathing. Because tomorrow the sun will rise. Who knows what the tide could bring?
WILSON!
I'm sorry, Wilson. Wilson, I'm sorry! I'm sorry!
We live and we die by time, and we must not commit the sin of turning our back on time.
Aha. Look what I've created. I have made FIRE.
Don't worry Wilson, I'll do all the paddling. You just hang on.

[to Wilson]
We might just make it. Did that thought ever cross your brain? Well, regardless, I would rather take my chance out there on the ocean than to stay here and die on this shithole island, spending the rest of my life talking...
[suddenly yelling]
...TO A GODDAMN VOLLEYBALL!
Gotta love crab. In the nick of time too. I couldn't take much more of those coconuts. Coconut milk is a natural laxative. That's something Gilligan never told us.
I couldn't even kill myself the way I wanted to. I had power over nothing.
[last lines]
You look lost.
I do?
Where're you headed?
Well, I was just about to figure that out.

Well, that's 83 South. And this road here will hook you up with I-40 East. If you turn right, that'll take you to Amarillo, Flagstaff, California. And if you head back that direction, you'll find a whole lot of nothing all the way to Canada.
I got it.
All right, then. Good luck, cowboy.
Thank you.
I always knew you were alive, I knew it. Everybody said that I had to let you go. I love you. You're the love of my life.
I love you too, Kelly. More than you'll ever know.
We buried you. There was a coffin, a gravestone... the whole thing.
I had a coffin?
[Stan nods]
Well what was in it?

[reading from a birthday card]
The most beautiful thing in the world is, of course, the world itself.
You wouldn't have a match by any chance would you?
We live and we die by the clock, that's all we have.
87 hours is an eternity. The cosmos was created in less time.
I'm always going to keep this watch on Memphis time. Kelly time.
So, let me get one thing straight here... We have a pro football team now, but they're in Nashville?
First thing it's two minutes, then four, then six, then the next thing you know, we're the U.S. mail.
That's a search area of 500,000 square miles. That's twice the size of Texas. They may never find us.

Do, do you have to keep bringing that up, huh? Ok, so it was a good thing we did a test because it wasn't going to be just a quick snap. Would've broken my neck, or leg or my back. Would've bled to death on the beach, but it's in the past. It was what, a year ago? SO let's just forget it.
I'll be right back.

[after seeing his "sail" fall over]
This could work! This could work...

[to Kelly]
You need to go home.
Let's not commit the sin of turning our back on time.
[Chuck talks to Wilson, the volleyball]
Hey, you want to hear something funny? My dentist's name is James Spalding.
Hey, HEY, It's a ship. HEY. HEY. HEY SHIP. HEY. Wait, look look, S.O.S... Oh come on. HELP. Please.
I should've never gotten on that plane. I should've never gotten out of the car.
You said you'd be right back.
I'm so sorry.
Me too.
[reading label on portable outhouse that has washed ashore]
Bakersfield? BAKERSFIELD! BAKERSFIELD!
If I'm here New Year's Eve, then I'm here. If I'm not, I'm not.
Nickolai. Tick-tock. Tick-tock. Tick-tock.
Hey, is all this turbulence from Santa and those eight tiny reindeer?
Hello! Anybody?
